meanings.definition: To have more courage than; to challenge or provoke someone to do something risky or dangerous.
meanings.sent1: She overdares her friend to jump off the swing.
meanings.sent2: He always overdares his classmates to climb the tallest tree.
meanings.sent3: The siblings overdares each other to see who can hold their breath the longest.
meanings.sent4: The daredevil overdares the laws of gravity with his stunts.
meanings.sent5: The explorer overdares the unknown territories with his fearless spirit.

meanings.definition: To exceed the proper limits or boundaries of daring or boldness.
meanings.sent1: The magician overdares his tricks, risking mistakes.
meanings.sent2: She overdares her luck by entering the contest without preparation.
meanings.sent3: The chef overdares the recipe by adding too many spices.
meanings.sent4: The driver overdares the speed limit on the highway.
meanings.sent5: The artist overdares the critics with his unconventional style.
